description: V2.3b: Differentiated SAB/SB bar tapers + selective shear threshold (S>0.95) + physics-motivated radial placement
changes_from_v2p3: 1. SAB bar taper KEPT (R_bar=2.0*R_d, gamma=1.5) - it worked!
2. SB bar taper STRENGTHENED (R_bar=1.5*R_d, gamma=2.5) - bars end ~1.5-2.0 R_d
3. Shear threshold RAISED to 0.95 (from 0.5) - only chaotic disks, not moderate shear
4. Shear taper MOVED INWARD to R_shear=2.0*R_d (from 2.5) - spiral region
5. Shear response STEEPENED to gamma=2.0 (from 1.0) - sharper cutoff
comment_bar_differentiation: NEW V2.3b: Separate SAB and SB parameters based on V2.3 lessons
comment_shear_selectivity: NEW V2.3b: Only truly chaotic disks (S>0.95), sharper cutoff inside spiral region
physics_rationale: - Shear taper too broad (94% of galaxies) -> MAKE SELECTIVE (S>0.95)
- Strong bars (SB) end at ~1.5 R_d (corotation radius)
- Weak bars (SAB) extend to ~2.0 R_d with partial coherence
- Chaotic velocity fields (S>0.95) destroy azimuthal coherence
- Spiral region dominates R < 2.0 R_d, not 2.5 R_d
- Keep V2.1 ring concentration (R_ring, sigma) - it worked
- Keep hard saturation (ablation showed Δχ²=+292 without it)
- Keep two-predictor lambda (B/T, shear) - addresses red overshoot
- DON'T disturb early-type performance (22.42% -> 23.15%, still good)
